name: Basque Tomato Salad
author: Teresa
summary: I lived in the Central Valley in California for many years which was one of the small handful of places in the U.S. where you could find authentic Basque food. This simple salad is wonderful after it has marinated for a couple of hours.
ingredients: 4  roma (plum) tomatoes, quartered, or more to taste
1  green bell pepper, sliced into thin rings
directions: Place tomatoes in a shallow serving dish
Arrange green bell pepper rings on top of onions
Combine olive oil, cider vinegar, garlic, parsley, salt, sugar, and black pepper in a jar
Close jar tightly and shake vigorously until dressing is well-mixed
Pour dressing over tomatoes, onions, and peppers
Refrigerate until flavors combine, about 2 hours
